body.p: To His Excellency, B. Magoffin, Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned are informed that Robert Agee, an enlisted soldier in Capt James R. Page's company, a few days ago, whilst intoxicated, committed a breach of the peace, by throwing a stone at a lady. He is sorry and penitent for being drunk and throwing the stone; the lady has forgiven him, as well as her husband. Under pea belief that the man is penitent for his conduct, and that he will hereafter conduct himself properly, we ask that your Excellency will interpose and order his discharge from imprisonment

A G. Hodges
A. C. Keenan
J Harlan
R. R. Bolling
Wm A Gaines
A, W, Brown
I. S. McNoel
John R Graham

Remitted
B. M.
Frankfort Po Ct
$50. } Breach
Robt Agee
Issd Aug 9th 1862
